availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Boone County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Minerva Stephens. Father of Frances Stephens, Mary Stephens, Benjamin Stephens, Albert Stephens, and Ella Stephens. Farmer in Boone County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Boone County in 1860. Identifies as a Justice of the Peace for Boone County in Allen Wilhoit and Lucinda Wilhoit testimony on September 10, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Florence, p. 276.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Florence, p. 93.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, Livingston County, Jackson, p. 583.
